submit.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve
submit.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: All applications must be submitted by Monday.
submit.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to agree to obey someone or something or to go through a process, especially when you have no choice
submit.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Derek has agreed to submit to questioning.
submit.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I submit that the jury has been influenced by the publicity in this case.
submit.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve
submit.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: All applications must be submitted by Monday.
submit.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to agree to obey a person, group, or set of rules
submit.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: We are willing to submit to arbitration.
submit.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: I submit that the jury has been influenced by the publicity in this case.
